intro: Maesa emirnensis, commonly known as the Emirnensis Maesa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of eastern Turkey and northern Iraq. The plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form, with small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
